Methods in com.brightcove.player.event with parameters of type EventListener
protected  void AbstractComponent.addListener(String eventType, EventListener listener)
          Convenience method to add an EventListener for the given type using the EventEmitter.on() method.
 int EventEmitter.on(String eventType, EventListener listener)
          Register an eventListener to be called when an EventType is emitted
 int EventEmitterImpl.on(String eventType, EventListener listener)
          Adds the listener to the event queue, returns a token that the caller can use to off itself.
 int RegisteringEventEmitter.on(String eventType, EventListener listener)
          Add a listener for an EventType, filtered by what the component is allowed to listen for.
 int EventEmitter.once(String eventType, EventListener listener)
          Similar to on, except that the listener will be removed after processing one event.
 int EventEmitterImpl.once(String eventType, EventListener listener)
          Similar to on, except that the listener is removed after processing one event.
 int RegisteringEventEmitter.once(String eventType, EventListener listener)
          Add a listener for an EventType, filtered by what the component is allowed to listen for.
 void EventEmitter.request(String eventType, EventListener listener)
          Requests a response from the first listener to respond.
 void EventEmitterImpl.request(String eventType, EventListener listener)
          Attaches a listener and fires off an event of eventType, with the hope that there's a corresponding listener set to 'respond' to the listener specified in the request.
 void RegisteringEventEmitter.request(String eventType, EventListener listener)
          Requests a response from the first listener to respond.
 void EventEmitter.request(String eventType, Map<String,Object> properties, EventListener listener)
          Request a response from the first listener to respond.
 void EventEmitterImpl.request(String eventType, Map<String,Object> properties, EventListener listener)
          Similar to above, except the properties map is passed along
 void RegisteringEventEmitter.request(String eventType, Map<String,Object> properties, EventListener listener)
